name: RTQQuestionnaire
title: Regulatory Questionnaire
description: Profile of Questionnaire for regulatory exchange of questions, issues and information requests between regulators and industry in the medicinal product lifecycle.

element.short: Contact parties for regulatory questionnaire exchange
element.definition: Contact details for parties involved in the creation, review, or submission of the questionnaire, such as the regulator and market authorization holder, to enable secure communication in medicinal product regulatory processes.

Contact information for the regulatory authority (e.g., FDA, EMA, PMDA) sending or reviewing the questionnaire, including name, title, and communication channels for official regulated product assessments.
The full name of the individual representing the regulator, used to personalize and route communications in regulatory affairs workflows.

element.short: Full name and job title of the regulatory contact
element.definition: The complete name of the regulatory contact, with the text used to capture the person's job title (e.g., 'Dr. Jane Smith, Regulatory Project Manager') for role-based identification in life sciences regulatory interactions.
Contact methods (e.g., email, phone) for the regulatory authority, ensuring reliable exchange of questionnaire data and responses in medicinal product submissions.
The type of telecommunication system used for contacting the regulator, such as 'email' for secure document transmission or 'phone' for urgent clarifications.
The actual telecommunication value, such as an email address or phone number, for direct outreach to the regulatory contact in biopharmaceutical processes.

element.short: Purpose of this contact method (i.e., work)
element.definition: Identifies the intended use of the telecommunication channel for official regulatory communications.

element.short: Order of preference for contact methods
element.definition: The relative importance or order of preference for using this telecommunication channel when multiple options are available for regulator contact.
Mailing or physical address of the regulatory authority, useful for formal correspondence or document submissions in healthcare regulatory affairs.
The purpose of the address for the official regulatory office location in life sciences contexts.
Specifies whether the address is postal, physical, or both, for accurate routing of regulatory materials.
A human-readable formatted version of the address for the regulator, combining all components for quick reference.
Address lines for street, suite, or other sub-address details of the regulatory office.
The city or locality where the regulatory contact is based.
The district or sub-region within the city for the regulator's address.
The state, province, or equivalent for the regulatory authority's location.
The postal or ZIP code for the regulator's address.
The country where the regulatory contact is located, using ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 codes.

element.short: Contact details for the Market Authorization Holder (MAH)
element.definition: Contact information for the Market Authorization Holder (MAH) or applicant receiving the questionnaire, including name, title, and communication channels for medicinal product lifecycle management.
The full name of the individual representing the MAH, used for accountability in regulatory submissions.

element.short: Full name and job title of the MAH contact
element.definition: The complete name of the MAH contact, with the text used to capture the person's job title (e.g., 'John Doe, Regulatory Affairs Manager') for role-based identification in regulatory workflows.
Contact methods (e.g., email, phone) for the MAH, supporting efficient response to regulatory questionnaires.
The type of telecommunication system used for contacting the MAH, such as 'email' for submission portals.
The actual telecommunication value for the MAH contact, enabling direct regulatory coordination.

element.short: Purpose of this contact method (i.e., work)
element.definition: Identifies the intended use of the telecommunication channel for MAH business operations.

element.short: Order of preference for contact methods
element.definition: The relative importance or order of preference for using this telecommunication channel for MAH responses.
Mailing or physical address of the MAH, for formal regulatory documentation.
The purpose of the address for the MAH's corporate headquarters.
Specifies whether the address is postal, physical, or both, for MAH correspondence.
A human-readable formatted version of the MAH address for quick reference.
Address lines for street, suite, or other sub-address details of the MAH.
The city or locality where the MAH contact is based.
The district or sub-region within the city for the MAH's address.
The state, province, or equivalent for the MAH's location.
The postal or ZIP code for the MAH's address.
The country where the MAH is located, using ISO 3166-1 alpha-2.

element.short: CTD-based category code that classifies the regulatory topic of this question/group
element.definition: A required code from the RTQ CTD Categories CodeSystem (or an allowed extension of it) that identifies which section, subsection, or specific regulatory topic within a medicinal product dossier this questionnaire item pertains to. This enables precise mapping and automated routing in regulatory processes.
element.comment: Examples: '2-3-s-4-2' = Nonclinical Overview, '3-2-p-5-3' = Microbiological quality control, etc.

binding.description: Codes from the full CTD hierarchy as defined in the RTQ CTD Categories CodeSystem. Additional codes beyond the standard CTD structure may be defined locally or in future versions of the CodeSystem when new regulatory topics are required.

element.short: Human-readable title of the CTD category
